comment: Professor Kwon never showed up for lab. We were taught by a TA that was pretty good himself, but no guarantee that he'll stick around. The actual professor never showed up, nor responded to emails. The TA didn't even know if he would show up either.
He's pretty funny. Labs are easy, but his directions are a bit confusing. He is always willing to help clarify and demonstrate though. He graded the reports pretty leniently. It's easy to get an A.

Great Professor - very knowledgeable and cares about students.  Grade consisted of 4 exams and D2L quizzes each week.  No homework but to do well on the exams all the class examples and suggested book problems should be thoroughly understood.  By the end of the course you will be well prepared for the Geotech section on FE Exam.  Highly recommend.

Best online class I have taken. I got a D in my last SOM class because the lectures were actually useless and we had no example problems. So I took his class online and I was able to learn and teach myself everything with given resources. Quizzes and tests also did not contain questions with content or examples that were not covered.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Kwon's lectures are terrible, he goes super fast and doesn't answer questions. But there is no homework, and his quizzes and exams are just like the practice problems in the lecture slides. Lecture is straight from the book, so it is easy for find answers to the practice problems. He doesn't test on theory, just plug and chug problems.

Jay was a great professor he has quizzes that are easy, and then the tests are the exact quizzes but stepped up a notch. So the tests are never curve ball questions you've never seen before. Additionally he really knows how to teach. Cool and down to earth professor. He said his biggest complaint was moving too fast and he changed to make up.

Stand up guy and very knowledgeable and experienced about everything geotechnical. He is willing to help and accessible outside of class hours. Overall, I genuinely enjoyed his class and would take him again if possible.

I was hesitant to take this course due to the previous negative reviews, but luckily my experience was much better than expected. He dropped the lowest quiz and test grade. If you do the recommended practice problems, you will do well on the tests. He gives you two hours for most tests and that was plenty of time. I would take his course again.

Isn't helpful at all. Worse in online courses since there's less time for tests. His tests are hard and there isn't enough time to complete them. WIll not take late submissions for test answers even if they are only a minute late. Doesn't respond to emails. Wouldn't recommend to anyone who needs an A in the class.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: He's okay. He goes really fast and doesn't like answering questions, even though he stops to ask on occasions. He is good for lab, just not lecture. The book may teach you better.
Hilarious professor, but the class is hard itself. Tests are really difficult and come from lectures, homework and quizzes. Pay close attention and try not to miss any lectures.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: I had Kwon for Strengths Lab and he was great. He said he would grade lab reports hard and that seemed true based on other groups grades, but my group put a lot of time in to our reports and never scored lower than a 95. Theres a midterm and final over the labs, and a report due for every lab. Follow the lab instructions exactly and youre set.
